reasoning: Subcoronal hypospadias is the most common anatomical variant of hypospadias, accounting for approximately 50-60% of all cases. Based on global hypospadias incidence of ~3.5 per 1000 male births (3500 per 100k), subcoronal variant estimated at ~10.5 per 100k births.
source: International birth defect surveillance and urological epidemiology data
